item.description:
You should have great weather for this hike with a view.

The Tripyramid massif includes three peaks: North Tripyramid (4,180 feet - #32 on AMC NH 4K list), Middle Tripyramid (4,140 feet - #35 on AMC NH 4K list), and South Tripyramid (4,100 feet - not considered an official 4,000 footer because there is not a sufficient change in altitude between its neighboring peak). The Tripyramids are best known for their slides, exposed slabs of rock that are visible from long distances, offer great views while hiking, and make for a unique trail.

Hike 2 of the 3 Tripyramid summits, North Peak at 4180' & Middle Peak at 4140' and catch sensational views into the Sandwich Wilderness and beyond! It is just 4 miles to the first summit, with 2800' of elevation gain to North Peak in 3 hours 30 minutes.



Notes: Due to WMNF wilderness regulations only 10 hikers allowed per group



This parking location is about 7 miles East of the hairpin turn, 1 mile West of Sabbaday Falls. There is no parking lot. Legally park at the sides of the road. This is a strenuous hike with a round trip of 9.6 miles 3,450' of elevation gain in a book time of 6 hours, 30 minutes.



Trail characteristics: Rocky, boulder climbs, & slides. Proper hiking boots and gear is mandatory.
Where:Pine Bend Brook Trailhead, Bartlett , NH 03812

The AMC trail description can be found here Tripyrimids via Pine Bend TH
item.how_to_find_us: There is no parking lot. Legally park at the sides of the road
item.name: The Tripyramids North & Middle from the Kancamagus
